info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hunterdon, southwestern Warren, north central Bucks and southeastern Northampton Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ferndale, or 9 miles south of Easton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Alpha, Ferndale, Milford, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Glendon, Springtown, Revere and Phillipsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 75 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
